website_summaries.verdict: Convenient, compressed alfalfa cubes that can provide a boost in oral and digestive health to the guinea pigs that will eat them.
pros: These alfalfa cubes are great for digestion, as they are packed with fiber
They come in compressed form that is easy to feed and is great for teeth
Also fulfills guinea pigs' urge to chew
Other small pets like bunnies also enjoy them
cons: Some guinea pigs don't like them
Rare reports of stale cubes upon delivery

customer_reviews.title: While the product seemed to be as described, my ...
customer_reviews.text: While the product seemed to be as described, my guinea pig wouldn't touch it. I finally purchased another brand of compressed hay, and he ate all of that right away. This brand did not smell as fresh as the other brand I purchased. I will not purchase these again, and I threw away what I had.
customer_reviews.author: Public name

customer_reviews.title: Our rabbits love these cubes
customer_reviews.text: Our rabbits love these cubes. great for their diet, I like the hardness of the cubes as it provides good chewing for their teeth. The only reason to give them 4 stars and not 5 is that I do get bags (I have ordered several) where a number of the cubes are a bit busted up. Chances are that has happened in shipping and handling, not a fault of the manufacturer. I will keep ordering these as long as we own any rabbits. I would recommend them for rabbit owners, but remember these are a treat and not to be used in place of a regular diet of pellets and greens.
customer_reviews.author: V. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Bring back the alfalfa that isn’t compressed cubes
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my baby rabbits cuz Kaytee brand stopped making the non compressed form of alfalfa hay. My rabbits hate and despise this stuff. It's way to hard to chew, the block doesn’t fit in their hay rack so it sits in the bowl and they just can’t get a good grip on it. They lost interest after less than a day and I had to give them Timothy hay to keep them alive. Don’t waste your money on this compressed junk.
customer_reviews.author: L. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: My rabbits won't eat these.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because one of my rabbits was scratching her pellets out of her feeder and I wanted to give her a food she couldn't spill everywhere. Not only did she not like these cubes, NONE of my rabbits would eat them. A waste of money. I gave 2 stars because it arrived intact and on schedule.
customer_reviews.author: L. Acree

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor but...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my horse - we train with +r so treats are essential to our training. The cubes were delivered like bricks.. I have a hard time even breaking them apart - The was ONE cube that broke up like fresh Alfafa but the rest were very stale... HOWEVER...my horse LOVES the taste... I just feel bad for him watching him chew
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Kaytee Alfalfa Cubes
customer_reviews.text: Our guinea pigs LOVE these cubes, we keep them in their cage at all times as something 'extra' for them to gnaw on. When they can't find one they'll start chewing on the bars of the cage letting us know it's time to give them another cube.
customer_reviews.author: N. Cousino

customer_reviews.title: Like Crack for my bunnies! 😂
customer_reviews.text: I just bought 2 dutch bunnies. I am new to the bunny world and everything is currently trial and error and much research. This purchase was given ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ From Hip and Hop. They each loved these little cubes. They are a bit messy after they have been eating at them for awhile but I suppose regular timothy hay can be as well. Regardless, my baby bunnies love love love this stuff. I will be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Tiptonthebriard

customer_reviews.title: Great snack for Bunnies to chew on
customer_reviews.text: My bunny loves these cubes. Bought a bulk box from a different supplier and my Bun just wasn't having it. Unfortunately they're just too expensive for alfalfa as a primary food, he's a juvenile so his diet should consist of mostly alfalfa. Have turned to pellets mostly but will go back to these as treats when he reaches maturity.
customer_reviews.author: Erickia S.

customer_reviews.title: Chinchillas don't like these
customer_reviews.text: Everything was ok. My chinchillas would not eat these. I bought 3 bags thinking they would like them to chew on since they are constantly chewing. I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Camarena

customer_reviews.title: I wanted this so my bunny would stop making a ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this so my bunny would stop making a alfalfa mess but he will not eat it . Not even if I broke it up. Save your money and stick to the regular.
customer_reviews.author: Heather V

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product. Guinea pigs wont touch them
customer_reviews.text: These are horribly packaged. The cubes poked the bag and caused the bag to rip, leaving tiny flecks of hay all over the place. More importantly my guinea pigs won't eat them because they are hard and they do not break apart like hey. They are clumped together in a rock hard solid ball as if they were soaking wet and then dried clumped together. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not for young guinea pigs
customer_reviews.text: Our piggies didn’t like them at all, but they’re still young. I broke these up into super small chunks and then they ate them... but they weren’t excited about them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lucky i had a backup plan
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Bunny whose 4 months, he wont touch it after eating timothy hay. My guinea pig eats it though!
customer_reviews.author: olivia

customer_reviews.title: Plastic in our hay
customer_reviews.text: Thank God I caught this befor giving it to my rabbit, not happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rabbit loves it
customer_reviews.text: My pet rabbit loves those things she goes crazy when she sees the pack she immediately snatches one out of our hands and she runs with it in her favored hiding spot they were fast delivered and it’s good value I bought 3 packs and I will definitely order more soon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The guinea pigs were not very interested
customer_reviews.text: The cubes were too tightly packed together and the guinea pigs didn't really eat them.
customer_reviews.author: Albie

customer_reviews.title: This is only good for baby rabbits
customer_reviews.text: This is only good for baby rabbits. For a adult rabbit it has too much protein and fiber which can caus kidney problems if consumed to much. I recommend buying the Timothy hay cubes if shopping for a Adult. If you have already been feeding this to a Adult Rabbit for a while I recommend consulting with a exotic vet and purchase Oxbow Natural Science Urinary Support Tables.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Fulop

customer_reviews.title: From time to time
customer_reviews.text: Seems like the alfalfa softens their stool. Not for everyday
customer_reviews.author: Selena Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Very Fresh
customer_reviews.text: My Bunny loves it. Just bag should be better quality so we can close it and doesn't get dry.
customer_reviews.author: rinku patel

customer_reviews.title: Our Guinea Pig Loves these cubes
customer_reviews.text: Our Guinea Pig loves these cubes. We usually give him these as extra treats.
customer_reviews.author: LLP

customer_reviews.title: Great chew toys
customer_reviews.text: My bunny loves these. He is very picky with chew toys and these are probably the one ones he really enjoys. Its the third time I buy them. I give one small piece a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My bunny won’t eat them.
customer_reviews.text: My mini lop won’t touch them. Probably going to donate them to the local MSPCA.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Silveira

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I could only guess on the flavor I didn't eat any but the guinea pigs love them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Rabbits hate it. It comes compressed in cubes and the rabbits only like the loose stuff (which is what pet supply stores sell)
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Good snack
customer_reviews.text: Good snack for my little pets.Both of them all like that.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Can't really judge with no comparison
customer_reviews.text: I hate kaytee products in general but they are the only company I've found with alfalfa cubes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: My chinchillas didn't take well to this, too hard and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Figueroa R.

product_meta.title: Kaytee Alfalfa Cubes, 15-oz bag
product_meta.description: Size:3-PackKaytee Alfalfa Cubes are tightly compressed blocks of nutritious sun-cured alfalfa that are ideal as natural food treats for small animals.
feature_bullets: Nutritious sun-cured alfalfa that is ideal as natural food treats for small animals

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
